results.title: Flowers
results.brief_description:
The third music video / visual from iyla’s 2019 EP, the video ironically uses hypersaturated flowers to comment on the stereotypes of traditional male/female relationships.

Director/DP/Editor: Patrick “Embryo” Tapu

results.title: Flowering plants and their parts
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Stanley Croner and Charles L. Finance
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Life Science”.
Relates the roots, stems and leaves of plants to plant growth and reproduction. Illustrates the ability of plants to adapt to their environment.

results.title: Flowergirl
results.creator_credit: Red Carpet Productions, Anthony Anderson and Cate Shortland
results.brief_description: Daisuke, Hana and Tetsu are three young Japanese tourists who share a flat in Sydney’s Bondi Beach. Daisuke has to return to Japan to work in his father’s butcher shop but his return is made bitter because of his falling in love with Hana. Featuring a fragmented narrative utilising video and 16mm film, this beautifully shot short film was voted the Best Short Film of 1999 by the Critic’s Circle of Australia.

results.title: Flower stories
results.creator_credit: HTV West, Taurus-Film, Richard Price Television, Terry Harding and Kate Canning
results.brief_description: A compilation of 8 animated stories aimed to entertain children aged between 3-9 years and featuring James, a fat black and white cat. The central theme for all the stories is “flowers”. Very colorful! Animation by Sue Allen. Storyteller: Alan Taylor.

results.title: Flower gardens
results.creator_credit: Perennial Productions, Stuart Crowner and Bruce Franchini
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Gardens of the world”.
Perhaps no garden in the world exhibits a more exhilirating use of flowers than Claude Monet’s garden at Giverny. Monet’s exuberant palette of colours strikingly contrasts with the grace and elegance of the classic perennial borders found at Tintinhull House in Somerset, England. The native flora of America’s southeast further illustrate the range of aesthetics and pleasure found in the world’s most beautiful flower gardens. Hosted by Audrey Hepburn and narrated by Michael York.

results.title: Flower buds
results.creator_credit: Central Newsreel and Documentary Film Studio of the People's Republic of China
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “China Today”.
This film covers cultural aspects of children’s lives in China such as dance, children’s orchestra, singing, folk-dance, traditional music and instruments. Non-stylised overview of traditional cultural traditions as demonstrated by children.

results.title: Flower
results.brief_description: When Jenova Chen and Nicholas Clark designed Flower, they approached it as more of an interactive artwork than a traditional videogame.

constellations_primary.name: Flower on the wind
constellations_primary.description: Explore the use of flowers in the moving image as an aesthetic and metaphor.

results.description:
When Jenova Chen and Nicholas Clark designed Flower, they approached it as more of an interactive artwork than a traditional videogame.

Flower lets you control the wind as it blows a single flower petal around the stages. The petal interacts with various elements in the world, triggering wind turbines or rejuvenating the landscape.

Rather than focus on traditional design principles of ‘fun’ or challenging gameplay, Chen and Clark instead worked to create a meditative experience they hoped would provoke positive emotions in the player.
description_for_label:
When Jenova Chen and Nicholas Clark designed Flower, they approached it as more of an interactive artwork than a traditional videogame.

Flower lets you control the wind as it blows a single flower petal around the stages. The petal interacts with various elements in the world, triggering wind turbines or rejuvenating the landscape.

Rather than focus on traditional design principles of ‘fun’ or challenging gameplay, Chen and Clark instead worked to create a meditative experience they hoped would provoke positive emotions in the player.
